skill.name: geniml
skill.description: This skill should be used when working with genomic interval data (BED files) for machine learning tasks. Use for training region embeddings (Region2Vec, BEDspace), single-cell ATAC-seq analysis (scEmbed), building consensus peaks (universes), or any ML-based analysis of genomic regions. Applies to BED file collections, scATAC-seq data, chromatin accessibility datasets, and region-based genomic feature learning.

skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found. Content is documentation and examples aligned with genomic ML workflows.

content.value_statement: Genomic interval workflows are complex and repetitive across BED files and single cell data. Geniml provides clear steps for tokenization, embedding training, and consensus peak building.
actual_capabilities: Train Region2Vec embeddings from tokenized BED files
Build consensus peak universes with CC, CCF, ML, or HMM methods
Run BEDspace preprocessing, training, and similarity search
Generate scEmbed cell embeddings from scATAC-seq AnnData
Tokenize regions with hard, soft, or universe tokenization and check coverage
Build Text2BedNN search backends from embeddings and metadata
limitations: Requires BED files and a compatible universe for tokenization
BEDspace depends on external StarSpace installation
Large datasets and ML or HMM methods can be compute intensive
Does not perform raw read alignment or peak calling

use_cases.title: Embed BED datasets
use_cases.description: Create Region2Vec embeddings for large BED collections to compare region sets and build ML features.

use_cases.title: Cluster scATAC cells
use_cases.description: Train scEmbed on AnnData and integrate embeddings with scanpy for clustering and annotation.

use_cases.title: Build search indices
use_cases.description: Create Text2BedNN search backends to power metadata and text queries over genomic regions.

prompt_templates.title: Start with Region2Vec
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner wants a simple embedding workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the minimal steps to tokenize BED files, train Region2Vec, and evaluate embeddings.

prompt_templates.title: Build a universe
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs consensus peaks from many BED files
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe how to combine BED files, generate coverage, and build a CC universe with typical parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Train scEmbed
prompt_templates.scenario: User has scATAC AnnData and wants embeddings
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline the scEmbed workflow from tokenization to scanpy clustering with key parameters.

prompt_templates.title: BEDspace search
prompt_templates.scenario: Advanced user wants cross modal search
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to preprocess, train, compute distances, and run BEDspace searches for r2l and l2r queries.

output_examples.input: Summarize the steps to train Region2Vec and validate results.
output: Prepare a universe and organize BED files
Tokenize regions with a chosen threshold
Train Region2Vec with tuned dimensions and window size
Evaluate embeddings with silhouette and Davies-Bouldin scores

best_practices: Build a comprehensive universe before tokenization
Validate tokenization coverage and adjust thresholds if needed
Record model parameters and random seeds for reproducibility
anti_patterns: Mixing genome assemblies between BED files and the universe
Skipping pre tokenization for large scATAC datasets

faq.question: Is this compatible with my data formats?
faq.answer: It works with BED files and AnnData for scATAC workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Large datasets and ML or HMM methods can require significant memory and time.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: It integrates with scanpy and can be used from R via reticulate.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: The skill documents local workflows and does not access credentials or send data.

faq.question: What should I do if tokenization coverage is low?
faq.answer: Improve the universe, check genome assembly, or adjust overlap thresholds.

faq.question: How do Region2Vec and BEDspace differ?
faq.answer: Region2Vec embeds regions only, while BEDspace learns joint embeddings with metadata.
